content.description: Climbs up a technical slab to small sharp crimps pulling the initial overhang. Power through the small hold a make a big move before a few easier but not easy moves to the chains.

This route is so good!  Pretty delicate but cruiser to the grey overhang.  Pulling this section is probably the hardest moves, but the route stays on you to the end.  Many folks fall off the redpoint crux just under the chains.  Probably a little soft for 13a, but it's continuous enough to make that a hard call.
content.location: on the left side of the crag (before heading around the bushes to access the harder lines).

content.description: Start just left of the bench. Some initial balancy moves lead through a series of three bulges. The crux comes at the second, but the pump factor builds at the third between the last bolt and the anchor.
content.location: Left of Hierarchy, starts left of the stone bench.

content.description: Another good moderate climb.  Worth doing, although not quite a warm up for the rest of the cliff.
content.location: The rightmost route on the cliff.

content.description: Delicate moves to start on vertical gray rock.  This leads to a good shake, and then a tricky crux to a cruiser finish.  It's hard to find all of the holds on the onsight.
content.protection: bolts.  No anchor if I recall correctly.
content.location: Just to the right of Don't Tread on Me.

content.description: Start just to the right of the stone bench, pull the initial overhang on good holds, and work your way through a balancy section towards to two bulges/roofs above. Pull through both bulges (crux) using cool pockets and flake features.
content.location: follows a thin orange streak between two grey streaks just right of the stone bench.

content.description: Follows an orange streak to the right of Hierarchy.  A boulder problem crux right off the deck leads to fun climbing above on blocky sidepulls and open handed holds, with a second crux followed by a rest right in the middle.
content.location: Right of Hierarchy and the bench in the middle (more vertical) portion of the wall.

content.description: A pretty good route for a moderate at a wall of 12's and 13's.  Interesting low angle climbing.
content.location: Far right side of cliff, left of the 2 moderates here.
